es.situm.sdk.v1

Class SitumRouteCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.situm.sdk.v1.SitumRouteCalculator

  • public class SitumRouteCalculator
extends Object
    Class to compute routes inside a building. Currently are two types of routes:

    • Accesible Routes

      • This type of routes are suitable for wheelchairs, and are configured in the dashboard.

    • Not accesible routes

      • This type of routes are not valid for wheelchairs. This is the default type of route

    To create a route from this class three values are needed. We need the actual point, the destination point and if the route need to be suitable for wheel chairs. The points are SitumFloorPoints in metric coordinates

    With this class also we can obtain the distance of a route and compute the nearest position in the valid path given the estimated user position.

    See Also:
    SitumFloorPoint

    • Method Detail

      • distanceToGoal

        public static float distanceToGoal(List<SitumFloorPoint> route)
        Obtain the distance in meters to the goal of a route. Note: a common value for walking speed of a human is 1m/s, therefore this function also outputs distance in seconds to goal
        Parameters:
        route - List of SitumFloorPoint
        Returns:
        distance in meters

      • computeRoute

        public List<SitumFloorPoint> computeRoute(SitumFloorPoint from,
                                          SitumFloorPoint to,
                                          boolean suitableforwheelchairs)
        Method to compute a route. If the path graph not contains nodes then the result of calling this method is null. We want create accesible routes or not changing the suitableforwheelchairs param. Remember that the from and to params are SitumFloorPoints and the units of the x and y values are in meters
        Parameters:
        from - Start point of the route. Units: SitumFloorPoint(meters, meters, levelid)
        to - End point of the route. Units: SitumFloorPoint(meters, meters, levelid)
        suitableforwheelchairs - true if the route should be computed for wheelchairs, false otherwise
        Returns:
        List of SitumFloorPoint for the route. If no path found or the path is empty then return an empty list of SitumFloorPoint list

      • fitPositionToNearestPath

        public SitumFloorPoint fitPositionToNearestPath(SitumFloorPoint position)
        Computes the nearest position in the valid path given the estimated user position. This method might return null if not has path. The x and y values of the given SitumFloorPoint are in meters
        Parameters:
        position - current position.
        Returns:
        nearest position to path or null if the floor has no path
